entries.title: Player Interview: Darren
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"I played my first D&D game at highschool. It was a boring game where there were so many players and so little time that I could barely get to do anything, but it was still alright."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I've mostly only done D&D 5e, before we got into savage worlds. At highschool and mostly on Roll20."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Most of the fun that I get comes when I overcome some huge challenge, like with Lykel. When he was wrestling and battling the Fomorian, and battling with the dwarven soldiers."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A game where I don't get to do anything. Or where everything I do results in failure."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"In real life I mostly enjoyed making jokes about how I seduced a goblin as we were both falling to our deaths.Or interrogated a rock which I believed to be a gnome, while proclaiming myself as batman."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I've played Lykel and Cecil."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I play Darkest Dungeon, Blazblue, Fire Emblem, and a little bit of Skyrim. Mainly Fire Emblem."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"I suppose that I most enjoy acting upon some heroic quality. But I don't have many ideas aside from that. Aside from maybe risk-taking. Creating conflict amongst the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book of all times?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Hm. I suppose that the first few Eragon books were great."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: StrangeSpeeder

Other than that, having fun RPing."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"The most unfun thing that HAS happened imo, are 'cutscenes'. As an example, when encountering a new type of foe, we were 'supposed' to lose, and be rescued."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"Nothing in particular comes to mind, as I can remember "],[0,[1,1],2,"most"],[0,[],0," of what i cared about of any given campaing. I guess the time my party got betrayed in a dessert and had to fight off an aspect of tiamat and our rival party at the same time is one. Finding that same rival party dead in a dungeon, minus 1, and then going through said dungeon and finding it was everything i could do to keep my comrades alive, was another."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Arya, Alice, and the last one who's name escapes me, a weird scientist."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? So was another series by the same author who's name escapes me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Ratt
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"When I was 9 my babysitter walked us through a modern adventure, there werent stats dice or maps but it was still a ttrpg"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Good ones, I like them buy and large"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The exploration of a consistent universe. Things follow rules, and no two opposite things can happen at once (like a piece of wood simultaneously being on fire and impossible to set on fire), and roleplaying with a team that gets along"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A session where there was clearly something that the DM wanted to accomplish and they threw out rules, of both the game and of the in universe logic, to achieve it, in order to do something to the players, or where they let the players do anything throwing out the rules"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"From a private session with my family, when I was 10 I was the DM for totally free form diceless games my cousins would play at Thanksgiving, and it became a running gag that whenever I was bored I would either kill someone via bus or make someone find a cat that also was a god, the moment I still remember years later is when only one character was left, they walked out of their apartment building with a new robot arm, they we're getting evicted, feeling sad, when I hit them with a bus, instant death. I was hungry, and the adults were serving some kind of dessert. From an Ashenland game, the most recent campaign has been by far the best, and Alexis and Pines response to Als death was by far the best"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Kosh the fire cultist, Dober the Doglin Warlord and Pines the goblin sniper."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Lots, video games, board games and rpgs. I'm particularly fond of TF2, Portal, Munchkin and Legend"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Character creation from both the DMs and the Players side. There is world building character building and rules all in one"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Worm, I was emotionally invested through 7000 pages, that takes a lot"]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Wesley
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Around my junior year in high school"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"On and off for about 15 years with 2 games that lasted more than a year each, the longest being about 3 years. As well as a DM in a couple of games, the longest lasting about 6 months."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I get the most fun from telling a story through RP"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Being obviously railroaded into or out of a situation."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I had a Kitsune Wild Sorcerer in a 3.5 game that was going for about 8 months at the time who was in love with an NPC that acted as a teacher and a father figure to her. In this one session however that NPC had been found out to be working against the party toward some opposing goal. Being torn between her love for the NPC and her loyalty to the party the session turned into a very well performed drama between the party trying to convince her to leave the NPC and help them against him. Just as they thought they had her convinced she had managed to lure them into a trap for her love. The party had to fight both the NPC and her and they managed to defeat the NPC but he ran off and they subdued her. By the end of the session they had her convinced the NPC had her under some kind of spell that made her love him and she agreed with them, but knew that was not the truth because she had loved him for years before she had met the rest of the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Lael"]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"D&D(or other TTRPG), Warhammer 40k, Skyrim, Sims 4, Rimworld, and then just about any multiplayer game that a majority of my friends are playing at the time or any single player game that comes out that I feel like playing but those are the games I keep going back to all the time. My Steam library alone has around 300 games in it."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The one thing I like above all other things about TTRPGs is that there is no set way to handle anything. So you can do anything in an attempt to do what you are trying to do without it having to be preprogramed. Want to kill everything, go for it. Want to never have a single combat and solve everything by talking your way out of it or using politics to take care of everything , go for it."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"That is a hard question. I have 'read' more books in the last 2 years than I have in the rest of my life. If you asked me this question about 3 years ago I likely would say The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, but now? I have to give a top 5 in no order as I cant pick just one between these, Red Shirts by John Scalzi, the NPCs series by Drew Hayes, Off to Be the Wizard series by Scott Meyer, Hell Divers series by Nicholas Sansbury Smith, and Critical Failures series by Robert Bevan. I know this is not really a good answer to the question but I have been reading just so many good stories that are all still fresh enough in my mind that none of them stand out above the rest for me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Nope

Joined a D&D session, in Tabletop Simulator, and played a 5e one-shot as a warlock. After that I played another 3 short sessions, when that ended I looked to play more D&D sessions, which was when I started using roll20 and played the first campaign in this group. Technically that was the first actual campaign I played."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Aside from what is above, I haven't played much other than D&D. Although, in that campaign, many NPCs had the power to render the spellcasters useless in seconds, which falls under 4. Memorable anyway."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Yu'karin, Nithnirith, Eahthryd, X'arith, Rose and Augusta."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"That I remember I play the more recent xcom games, Albion online, H3VR, Kerbal Space Program, Dota 2, Divinity: Original Sin 2, Planetside 2, Borderlands 2 and Tower Unite. "]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The idea that those fights mentioned on 3 can happen, although i do prefer to work up to it and then be presented to that type of situation, that appeals to me the most."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I haven't read any books lately."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: WolfHeart
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Although i knew about d&d since around 2012, my first actual experience was in i think 2014 when i was at some daytime summer camp thing and a group of kids were playing, i sat with them and watched every day until one day one of the players didnt show up and they offered me to play in their place"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Very little, i can never find anyone to play these kind of things with me, this is the first true group i had"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The roleplaying, ive heen roleplaying since like the age of 5 and never grew out of it, i had a couple larp? groups with kids in the neighborhood, both groups lasted several years in the same world/story, its since become a necessity for me and a coping mechanism"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"One player becoming very overpowered and it becoming a one player game because they do everything"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I dont really have any stories... but my character always had those shrooms"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Duflin Bundar, thats it, thats my only character, i really need to start playing again."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I am a very heavy roleplayer, i do so with a group of friends over a discord server svery waking moment that i have"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Becoming the character, like not existing as the player anymore, but as the character"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I dunno, ill just list some that i really like: the warrior cats series, war of the worlds, the hobbit, a monster calls, i cant think of them right now"]]]]]}

RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"My first TRPG experience, as in me playing an official one, with rules and everything  was probably on either the 21 or 22 of November 2019, or in that week, where I played my first D&D session."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"It would probably be either roleplaying certain roles, or, when something I didn't expect to your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Other than internet issues, the most un-fun thing I have experienced till now was getting killed by a critical ambush attack of an enemy on the first fight that I joined as this now dead character, but, among the theoretical idea I would find most un-fun, it would probably be repeating the same thing over and over without anything changing for a long time."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I don't have much experience in TRPGs, so, I think it would either be my first game of I might have played some other games, but, for now, those are the ones I can remember: offline RPGs, MMORPGs, strategy games, puzzles, riddles, a few cell phone games, and some games like Mario, Sonic, Zelda, Assassins Creed, and Call of Duty."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"It is probably the roleplaying of new characters."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I do read many genres of books, but, among the fiction books, my favorite would be Endless Path: Infinite Cosmos, a fanfiction which I find better than the original story it is based on."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: K9

entries.title: Player Interview: ProfBlanck
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Several years ago, I created a Completely Barebones and paper game with a friend, based on a book we had to read in school. I “GMed” many Campaigns, most no longer then 20minutes."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I have already GMed my first Campaign of DND 5e, and have been playing basically every week for around 2 years with a group of fellow Nerds."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I Think that RP is the beating heart of any pen and paper game, but I believe telling an interesting Story to be even more important than any One Charakters Actions."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Infighting. Everyone should have the same goal in mind, even if the PC wouldn’t agree with that goal."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"Once I was GMing a Dungeoncrawl, and after losing about 90% of his gold to a trap, the Rogue left behind the resting party, to search for treasure to make up for his loss. He proceeded to hit a sleep gas trap, get thrown in jail, fall into a Pitfall trap and Die. Not content with this, he quickly created a Second Rogue, identical to the first, only to, again, run headfirst into the dungeon, where he immediately fell into the same trap as bevor. I think he eventually ended up as a Succubuses plaything."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Till now only The Cyborg Dr Chimera and his Dog, Snuffles."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"DND, DOOM, and any Strategy games I can get my hands on."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Getting to imagine Fantastic Places and Landscapes, more beautiful then reality could ever be."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"V for Vendetta. In my opinion, Any book that manages to make a Story about a Crazed Supersoldier fighting a Malevolent Supercomputer into a Philosophical Question about Freedom, Safety and Rebellion deserves the highest honor."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Just Me
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"The first time I really played was on my first session with Tom, I tried once before that to play a Pick-up game on roll 20, but since it was my first time using Roll 20 I played with the drawing and measuring tools, the gm didn’t like that and threatened to kick me out... I found a button that toggled visibility for the measuring tool, and thought I was safe playing with it, but apparently it only toggled visibility for other players, so I got kicked out."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"The only system I played is Freeform Universal, with additional modifications by Tom and The Denizens Of His The Discord Server, and I had fun so far."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Sadly I am not a person capable of clearly explaining my own thoughts and emotions, so I am unable to say what exactly is the most fun thing in tabletop RPG’s, I can only say that my experience so far has been fun."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"It turns out that the gm had a timer running until all the PC’s die for some reason (Maybe it starts to rain people, And the PC’s get crushed or something), and players supposedly had enough time to prevent it, but they somehow ended up not knowing about it at all, so from their perspective they are playing normally, and then suddenly the gm announces that they all die. Another super un-fun thing would be to have a heart attack in real life."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I only played several sessions so far, all part of a continuous story, and I pretty much remember most of it :)."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I played as Carl, an engineer who has, for some reaso gained attention of the Machine God, and with it ability create metals and silica, which allows him to be a crafter, as he can magic gear into existence."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Sandboxes(Mechanica, Minecraft, Poly Bridge 1-2, Mindustry), Coding Games(Screeps(I played a bit alone, haven’t tried multiplayer yet), Foundry Macros), Top-Down Shooters(Helldivers, Soul Knight,TowerFortress(?)), Platformers(Trine 1-4, Broforce, Hollow Knight(But I didn’t ever finish it), Trover Saves The Universe), FPS(Ace of Spades(RIP AoS), Block N Load(Only a bit, AoS was better), Receiver 2, Super Hot), No Idea About Genre(Stone Story Rpg, Taur, Pulsar Lost Colony, Clustertruck, Bug Academy, Bigfoot, SPACEPLAN, Venineth, Genital Jousting, Journey to the savage planet, WebLiero), Roguelike(COGMIND)"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The fact that the “Game Logic and Story Engine” is a human, which offers a lot of play-time flexibility, much more than a machine alone is capable of providing at the current level of technological development(There is a text game called AI Dungeon, which uses a neural network(OpenAi’s GPT-2) to generate text output based on your input, and it is quite interesting, but that “Cutting Edge” is still nowhere close to what a human could do.)."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book of all times?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Choice is hard, so I will name several I liked :) :The Discworld Books, A hitchhiker’s guide to the Galaxy, Bobiverse series... Carl@fire (It isn’t a book, but a web serial)."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Casatex
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["em"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Played at a friend's house in 2016"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I've been majorly a dm for four years (I started dming a few months after I first started)"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Depends on the setting and people I'm playing with, but the entire aspect of the game is pretty fun most of the time"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Most un-fun is when a problem occurs and people don't want to correct it, especially when it's because of someone who won't let it go (such as having an OP weapon, or some homebrew that just isn't balanced)"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"My most memorable story I remember from a session was when I was running a 2-year campaign for a group of really good players, I had finally reached someone whose lore wasn't touched upon as the others but I had heavily hinted at and given a lot of mental-puzzles and hidden messages that he had taken quite well and solved a lot mostly correctly. Anyways, he had climbed to the summit of the tallest mountain in the world looking for answers, and he had found a special CR 27 Ancient White Wyrm I had prepared. He (and the party) were preparing for death at this creature, and some blood was spilt (his own) and a ritual which was tied into his lore had finally been unleashed. He had known that a mountain was the key, but had no idea it was this mountain in particular, and was extremely unnerved by the fact that something was happening towards that end after all this time, as were the other players - who wouldn't be with a monster of that strength looking down on them (it was colossal in size). So the ritual completes and a bright flash sends the snow-capped mountain spiraling it's snowfall everywhere until a man is left kneeling in the blood seal. This man is known as 'the one' in the world in question, an all-powerful and "],[0,[1,1],2,"evil"],[0,[],0," druid who unleashed a new era of evolving monsters unto the world and was barely stopped in the past"],[0,[1],1,"."],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"It was revealed that this druid was the reason for the player's existence along with his forever crush who both were magical spawns of leftover energy from when he was sealed and was the explanation for their power throughout the game."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"He was met with raised arms and once more a fight to the death, with the dragon claiming allegiance with the man. But it was further revealed through dialogue that he was not evil in the end, just trying to stop the same thing that the players are destined to stop themselves, and that he is "],[0,[1,1],2,"that player"],[0,[],0," from a previous cycle of the world which also gets revealed that the world continues to fail and the planes be consumed by the soulless and rebirthed by the now-fading gods. He had just happened to be the "],[0,[1,1],2,"only survivor"],[0,[],0," looking to stop that calamity from ever happening again. And to do so, he was going to channel all his might into a spell that would create dragons so powerful that they could stand up with the world's residents against the coming shadowfall."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"I play Walter in the Ashenland campaign, a politician fighting to gain power within Ashenland itself for reasons he keeps to himself, but otherwise is helpful towards other player's causes."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I play all sorts of games, from LOL, to MHW, and all things inbetween."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,9],[0,[],0,"Definitely the storytelling, especially that which can be told through combat"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,10],[0,[],0,"John Flanagan's The Ranger's Apprentice series is an amazing read"]]]]]}

entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"I played for the first time I was 9 with the older kids at my apartment building"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"we played about two campaigns of DnD for a couple of years then at the age of 13 through 16 had a solid group that alternated GMs and had a few different campaigns of 3DnT."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I think for me the best part of an RPG is when the group hits that sweet synergy spot in which you all know enough about each other to react together to things even if our characters goals differ. As in the group wants to reach past the dragon  doesn’t matter if it’s a cool epic battle or if the bard is just in the right mood for some kinky seduction, we would all be in it together."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Meta gaming and railroading I think are a given but also when people are too close minded and don’t accept that there are more ways to solve a problem and that people can have fun in different ways."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"A try hard sorcerer friend of mine was dead set on summoning a meteor rain on top of a battlefield not caring much for who would get hit be friend or foe. Most of the party that was close enough to hear him start chanting decided that knocking him out to save our army forced would be the best course of action - a ranger an assassin and a cleric all failed their rolls to actually knock him out or even hit him... he not only got to finish his casting but also landed a massive crit."],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"“Belohegor’s starts casting what seems to be a highly destructive magic, his friends jump trying to hold him back but his body starts glowing and a wave of raw magical power is unleashed from him knocking them aside. The skies darken as 3 castle sized meteors start descending the battle field and countless smaller ones. Jow the berserker barely noticed the change in lighting once the smaller pieces starting exploding around him he paid then no mind when the temperature started to rize he looked up but it was too late the largest of the meteors was right above his head and with a sight his final words were ‘Fuck magic’”"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Currently playing as Benjamin Deveraux"]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"I enjoy mmos such as WoW and ESO (looking forward for ashes of creation). Metroidvaniasand solo rpgs and stealth games like the ps spiderman, styx shard of darkness, hollow knight"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Builders such as the sims4 and planet coaster"],[1,[],0,9],[0,[],0,"And last but my favorite is Pokemon all of them just love it!"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,10],[0,[],0,"I think that the freedom to do anything you want, sure there are rules and the GM usually has a plot in mind but if my evil wizard wants to spend his weekend tending to his garden just because I can, imagination makes it fully limitless which is something videos games can never achieve."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,11],[0,[],0,"Best book ever is hard to decide... there are so many genders to choose from along with the fact that some books are precious due to how they affected me in a specific time of my life."],[1,[],0,12],[0,[],0,"Not the best written nor the best plot but the Perry Rhodan books have been with me for such a long time and I love the potential of their universe so much I have to pick it personally. (It’s a good thing to point out that to date there are over 3000 booklets so it’s a very rich world)"]]]]]}

entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"My first time playing pen-and-paper RPG was around 3 years ago."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Overall, it was a great experience with a mixture of bittersweet moments, especially when you have to undergo a few player character deaths a few time but what do you expect when fighting a bloody dragon or pissed off Lich King."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The interactions between players among themselves and NPC, be it good or bad. I always find it interesting to see how players react to certain situations that they would never dream to be nor want at times and how their creativity and ingenuity can get them out or in trouble. Either way, being part in the world that anything is literally possible is fun to be in."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"When a player being the personification of Chaotic Evil. I mean just because your character is one, doesn't mean you have to be. Be kind, don't be late for the session and the world does not revolve around one person. It encompasses the whole party."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"It happen when my lovely DM, Ben Griffin, drop a bombshell of a message from my character's home that his family was executed by his own people that he sworn an oath to protect. For a little context, my character at the time was Fenix Asim, a lawful good paladin human, whom a descendent from a family of paladin that sworn a sacred oath to safeguard his kingdom from foreign or evil invasions. He joins the party after he received an edict from the ruler of the kingdom to seek forth information on an organisation that threatens his kingdom and defeat them. So, after a few sessions and miraculously defeating one of the leaders of the organization, the party rested and restock in a nearby town. With the help of the party's wizard, Fenix send a message to his father's loyal aide about his progress and ask about the family. When the bad news received, it shook Fenix's whole foundation and the beginning of a beautiful vengeance oath which a certain king head eventually was decapitated (found out he was part of the organization), After a few sessions and with the help of the party. The reason why it memorable to me was due to the fact it was a wicked blindsided punch to the whole party as no one expected that to happen and it was awesome that my paladin became an oath breaker but saddening to see a sweet cinnamon roll of a man became broken and undergo major existentialism."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I am currently playing Selene Goodtree, a herbalist half Dryad from the Elysian Forest. She seek redemption for the death of her mother and her village after they were attacked by an unknown organisation. She currently travels to gain info and destroy the organisation."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I relatively play almost any games, be it mobile, PC or PlayStation, though these days majorly plays Mobile Legends, Final Fantasy (10 and 7 personal favourite), Genshin Impact, Among Us to name a few."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The immersion of able to join the GM world and explore it. I am a sucker to fantasy role play and story and able to dive in and interact with the world have been a major interest of mine. Plus, being able to be anyone you want to be is also a good reason keep coming back."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"That's difficult to answer since too many to choose from... Personal favourites would be Percy Jackson Saga, Skulduggery Pleasant series and Harry Potter series too and Darren Shan has a major spot in my heart since I grew up reading it."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Tomasz H.
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"It was in the beginning of my middle school, where I didn't realize yet it was called \"pen-and-paper RPG\" or \"tabletop RPG\". I was a fan of video RPGs though, so inspired by countless hours in front of computer, we tried to replicate this experience together with my closest friends. It's how I became an arbitrary game engine, processing their actions on a piece of paper passed between us, during one of many boring classes. I think the very first session featured some random pack of wolves attacking the player characters in a forest. They didn't have any concrete goal and I was just sentencing them to some situation which I subjectively found entertaining."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"More than dozen of years of various RPG campaigns, systems and styles, almost exclusively in a Game Master's role (sporadically swapping the roles with one of my players). The first campaign, or rather - unplanned set of loosely and accidentally interconnected sessions - was set in some generic, nameless fantasy world, with no RPG system at all. The players there were my IRL friends from school. Then, I've GMed a new campaign a for a couple of years in play-by-forum style (short PBF), featuring my friends from video browser game. It was the time I learned more about tabletop RPGs in general and tried to create some roleplaying system with use of randomness provided by random.org service. I took a few years of break from GMing during my university (which was a true rat race and a time sponge). At this time I took part in couple of sessions GMed by my friends in systems like D&D4e and Neuroshima. Soon, when Roll20 came out and my studies got slower and steadier, I decided to give it a try and quickly ended up with GMing another campaign - this time I gave up on homebrew systems and decided to try out the mainstream, that is D&D5e. After two years-long campaigns I grew frustrated of the mind frames this system wants to pack the roleplay into. For the third Roll20 campaign I switched to Savage Worlds, which sounded like a simple, universal and modular system. For the fourth campaign, I chose to ascend (or descend?) even further into a minimalistic system called Freeform Universal, which supports narrative roleplay and improvisation. After encountering couple of problems with Roll20, I quickly discovered alternatives. Soon, I downloaded FoundryVTT - a virtual tabletop software which can be adapted in any way you choose (shame it's behind a paywall now)."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I think it's the improvisation and viewing the world from someone else's perspective. Both of them are helpful IRL as well. Moreover, I like to watch the world of Ashenland growing, as more and more players shape its history."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"From GM perspective? Losing the control over the session/campaign. To give it a trivial example - players splitting the party for a longer period of time. It's un-fun for me because it features an extra burden of \"personalizing\" the descriptions, and un-fun for the players, because the less numerous group often gets less spotlight, sometimes merely simplified to singular action they perform - while the main group enjoys the complete roleplay. Another example of losing control would be players roleplaying without my knowledge. I have experienced it and it has the potential to ruin any element of session preparation a GM has in mind. Yet another example, this time out-of-character, would be a toxic drama-queen offending or diminishing the role of a GM, spreading the hatred on other players."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"Hm, well that's a number of stories to choose from... Let's say, a story where a masked, time-traveling ninja spots his past, younger self and decides to hug him. According to the popular culture, it's better not to mess with your past self - and a single roll for fact check proved it to be true this time. Their bodies immediately started to merge, producing loads of light. Fortunately, one of the player characters was a sorceress and prevented them from finishing the merge. Though both of them have lost an arm in the incident, the ninja decided to raise his younger self as a father he never had."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Halaur, a human cleric of Murn. Although he's young and frivolous, he's very cautious and loyal to his god in spreading his holy knowledge wherever possible. He detests filthy demons which try to doublecross the mortals and spread the fake news."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Obviously I play a lot of RPGs - both tabletop and video games from Gothic, Elder Scrolls, Witcher, Fallout, Cyberpunk and Divinity: Original Sin franchise, though sometimes I stray into management simulations like Dwarf Fortress or RimWorld, space simulations like Elite: Dangerous, economy simulations like Eve Online, strategies like Total War series, action shooters like Warframe or Apex Legends, dungeon crawls like Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup or hack-and-slashes like Diablo 2 or Path of Exile, survival sandboxes like Minecraft or Project Zomboid. From board games, Munchkin and Terraforming Mars are my favourite."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"GMing, of course! I think it is where I found myself. Per default it features a lot of planning, designing and creative work - but I have managed to elaborate a lean framework, in which such time-consuming parts can be easily delegated to your players. Not like if I'm not creative myself, but I like to keep the players invested by letting them describe the world from perspective of their characters."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Dan Simmons' Hyperion Cantos is a tough piece of sci-fi. There are ancient star systems, energy blasters, dying people, spaceship combat, psionic abilities, godlike entities... It's a fully-fledged story with some top-notch action. Also the first book is generally said to be the best, I think it's because of its structure - most of the chapters are prequels told by one of 7 pilgrims which travel together towards an enigmatic destination..."]]]]]}

entries.title: Kemono Islands
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["image",{"src":"https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/ashenlandlore/images/c/c3/Kemono_Archipelago.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/310?cb=20180630195142","alt":"","title":"","caption":"The 3 main islands","cardWidth":""}]],"markups":[["em"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono Islands are an archipelago located northeast of Ashenland, largely obscure to Ashenland because of it's way of life."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Overview"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono islands are in large part a monarchy made up of 9 different families, each attributing their nature to a different family of animals. Of the three islands, each is dominated by one of the race's three subspecies- Terrestrial, Aquatic, and Aerial. Three families rule over each island, and each family is led by a wisened and learned priestess which represents the rest of their family."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The 9 families keep knowledge of the arcane strictly obscure- Most common people don't even know that it exists, outside of what the nobles of the land show them."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The only ones with access to it are the 9 families and their branches of noblemen and nobleladies, supposedly by divine providence. The common people have advanced themselves technologically to make up for this lack of arcane power. Strict information control and harsh laws help to keep everything and everyone in these islands in order."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Geography"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono archipelago has 3 main islands, being them named Seijitsu, Zhuny, and Jumun, they're considered the provinces of this country. Besides several small islands who count as small cities."]]],[10,0],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Zhuny"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Zhuny means discipline. It is the main island, the biggest of them, the majority of the population is made of terrestrial kemonos, although many avian and aquatic kemonos can also be seen there. Zhuny has most of the population and it has a strong impact in the economic power of the entire country. Most of the goods consumed by the entirety of the population are made in here. Its main city is Dngjng, where the three palaces show where the priestess live. Each has its own set of temples, towers, residences, galleries, courtyards, gardens, and outbuildings. In the middle of the city, there is the highest of the temples, dedicated total and entirely to Inna, the goddess of moon and law. The priestesses in charge of this island are Jing Huang, Syaoran Mei, and Yuting Sui."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Seijitsu"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Seijutsu means law. It's the second biggest island, and the most technologically advanced one, the majority of the population is of aquatic kemonos, followed by their avian counterparts. Most new advents come from here, there's a noble order of artificers widely known, any nobleman from any island can become a part of the order if shown enough talent and determination. Magic is a bigger taboo in this island than any other, most public performances of arcane mastery are said to be technological tricks. The main city here is Tsuki, where the 3 main castles (Shiro) stay, they're home to the families of three main priestesses, being them named: Amane Rigo, Pak Hae-Ju, and Shakaku Rise."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Jumun"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[0],1,"Ju"],[0,[],0,"mun means order. It's the smallest of them all but it's still considered big. Jumun is the cultural and military center, which is why it's commonly the main place for the new year festivals, although each island makes their own festival. The capital is known as Seon-Yul and it has the largest and most intricately built of all the temples. They're artists and most of the magic users tend to prefer illusions and conjurations. The three palaces belong to Lee Dal-Nim, Mihiro Chidori, and Mo Daiyu."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Priestesses and Noble Families"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Status and social class plays an important role in how is your life in the Kemono islands. The priestess families are known and are rather antique, some of them dating back to the beginning of the country when only the Zhuny island was actually populated. Just like everything else related to religion, everything results in 9. It's not too common to see the priestess walking in the streets but sometimes they appear. Usually, if they're appearing to the public, they're in their dark blue, ceremonial clothing. The 9 priestess and their families will be listed here, in order of economic and political power."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Golden Rooster"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Jing family is the oldest and most powerful of all priestesses' families. Their priestess now is Huang, a young adult, about 150 years old. Huang is kind and altruistic and is a wonderful healer, often going around in the cities nearby and helping citizens. Even being good she still suffers a little prejudice for being an aerial kemono in a terrestrial kemono island. She's married and has one son."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Red Fox"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Shakaku family is a family of many branches, some of them lost their name like the Sasahi and the Akane families, they're considered lesser nobles. Surprisingly, the woman chosen for the priesthood was Rise, an egoistic and harsh woman of undeniable beauty. She rules with an iron fist and is often arguing with Hae-Ju about what should be done. She seems to be good friends with Rigo and they tend to help each other to convince or overcome Hae-Ju's opinion. She's about 275 years old, and although she has a daughter and two nieces none is being trained for priestery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Dumbo Octopus"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Lee family is almost as old as the Jing family, it rose up when the Jumun island was being populated. Dal-Nim, their priestess, is the main priestess in this island and is as amicable as can be. She has one daughter (Min, 11 years old) and is a widow. She teaches her daughter to be a priestess as compassionate as she is. You can often find her in the temple with her daughter. She says she won't marry again."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Gray Wolf"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Syaoran is a family of mostly men, it seems that each generation has 3 times as much males than females. Once every 3-5 generations, they choose one of the toddler girls to be the next priestess and that is the one who's trained. The priestesses from the Syaoran family usually devote their entire lives to the priesthood, another priestess only rises when the previous one dies. Their priestess now is the young Mei, 68 years old. Although her family has status, she's still considered a priestess in training for the other priestess due to her age and inexperience."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Violet Crow"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Mihiro family is known for their cleverness, they are the strategical part of the army, a fundamental role. They're one of the two families that choose priestesses based on their potential rather than birthrights, for this they have a slightly bad reputation. Chidori, 213 years-old, is the one in charge, for now, her companionability and intelligence are remarkable, being extremely precise in her calculations and quick to think she's the one in charge of the majority of the army. She was never married and she has the help of the son of her older brother and the two sons of her cousin to command the army, all of them are paladins and generals. They say she's a very demanding and perfectionist leader, having soldier train until reaching perfection. The Mihiro family also is the owner of the homonym school of archery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Masked Owl"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Mo family, just like the Mihiro family, is known for being smart, they're the ones responsible for the order of artificers, the Tekisa. They're the second family who has a kind of test for small girls become possible priestesses. Daiyu, 252 years-old, is known for her persuasion and determination. Learning quickly and being an avid reader she seems to enjoy spending time in the artificer order more than in any temple. She's always seeking technological advances in warfare and visits Chidori often, she makes the weapons and Chidori finds out the best way of using them. She's a single daughter and is married to Katsuo, Chidori's older brother, which makes people wonder if when her daughter becomes the next priestess will she be considered a Mo or a Mihiro."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Blue Dragon"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also known as The Blue Sea Slug, Pak is a small and not so popular family but, nonetheless, it's a priestess' family. They, like most other families, wait for Inna to bless a given child to train her for the priesthood. Hae-Ju is a young woman, have just completed her 188th birthday. She's cheerful and calm and seems to be the most devoted of all priestesses. She's often seen in the temple and has two sons, Yoosung (25) and Jumin(17), she has about 30 years of priestery and it the most inexperient one, being treated like Syaoran due to this. Both her children are part of the Tekisa."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Bloody Jelly"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Amane family is an old and traditional family, even if not holding that much power in itself. Their priestess is Rigo (324), a blind sorceress who's focused on divination magic, she's known for using magic blindsense at all times. The Amane family seems to be tied to almost every important family, and is one of the few families that always get politically advantageous marriages for the new generations when they're still super young, they seem to think that a child is much more adult than they look like and more often than not starts training their kids pretty early, around age 8. Rigo has two male sons and is married to a second branch Syaoran, her oldest granddaughter, Aino (19), is the one being trained for priestery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Cashmere Lop"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Yuting is another small and unpopular family, they have a couple of farms but nothing to be acknowledged for. Their priestess, Sui (267), is a small and shy woman from the secondary branch, all her cousins and siblings are male. She's usually always fretting around trying to keep Huang and Mei from fighting each other, she's very kind and altruistic. She is not married, and says she has no intention of doing so, therefore the next priestess might be her niece."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"The Revolution"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Rebellion is a movement to oust the 9 families from power and give freedom to the people. Their end goal is to spread knowledge of the secrets that said families have been hiding, and to expose the corruption that supposedly exists within those same families. The rebellion has been secretly supported by the Sasahi family, and is championed by a hero that leads them through the battle against the priestesses. The heroes position is passed down whenever the previous hero falls, along with his title."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Followers of the rebellion prefer to follow Inna's sister Katrina, the goddess of storms, the sea, and chaos."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"By Laura"]]]]}

entries.title: Ketu
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A half destroyed city near the coast. Has the biggest fighting arena existent, which brings lots of people to the town, problems with pirates make it a dangerous city but yet its seen as a beautiful city and visited by lots of people, specially due to beaches, fights and good drinks. Controlled by 3 pirate mafias this city constantly has legal problems due to its inside political fight. The main language spoken here is common but you can often hear people speaking aquan due to many merpeople and standing merfolk. Their economy spins around tourism and food is generally expensive here because theres no place to farm, seafood is highly consumed (and its quite cheaper) and they make the best rum in all Ashenland. The arena, named Kar Thalay, is the most important part of Ketu, located right in the middle of the city between the two main districts, Kidkan and Ngein, its half destroyed aspect is kept for aesthetic purposes but inside it has been rebuilt in order to accommodate more people with more comfort."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"The Pirates"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are 3 pirate crews controlling Ketu, none of them are liked by merpeople so it's common to see fights between pirates and merpeople."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Sea Angels"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"They are a crew made of generally pretty individuals, their 6 ships are the most threating for merfolk and this is also the greatest of crews. They're kind of neutral towards most laws but tend to do as they please. They're more famous for \"controlling\" brothels and all the slavery."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Their leader is Violette, an uncaring, provocative and elegant tiefling who's very skilled in bare-hand fighting and rarely spills blood, preferring to kill opponents with internal haemorrhages. Her devilish nature doesn't make her any less scared of flames, as she has a childhood trauma, and so she usually uses magic light wherever she needs."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Neptune Bandits"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This is a crew of urchins, poorer than the Angels so they have fewer ships but a crew just as big. they focus mostly on looting and are the greatest of problems for every ship, although they were seen ignoring deliberately the WW and this lead to a series of humours on whether the two leaders had a deal or a relationship of some sort."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Aggy, as she prefers to be called, was abandoned as a child and joined the Bandits for their treasure hunt, she was so utterly excited in the idea of finding such treasure that she got the map tattooed in herself. Being determined, she quickly climbed up the hierarchy. She's hot headed and imprudent but stubborn enough not to give up, she's willing to travel every sea to find that treasure and this inspiring behaviour conquered several men and women who were miserable. She constantly uses her innate magical powers to aid her melee combat and more often than not sets fire to other ships' sails before raiding them. When not on sea she can be found with her crew mates in one of the many pubs of the town, they kind of rule those."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Water Walkers"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Diplomatic and good-aligned pirates are a rare find, but aren't inexistent. The WW are opposing forces to both the Angels and the Bandits, they're way smaller than the other crews and are constantly shun at but still they managed to control a great part of the city since the last captain took the lead. They often raid and take down slave and other pirate ships, almost as a police force."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mykros, the elf-like water genasi, is very diplomatic and patient, which means many deals were made, but he does tend to be deceitful, tricking pirates into deals that basically makes them forcefully stop pirating even if they don't immediately notice it. He's constantly with his first-mate, a calm and quiet fire genasi who worked really hard to be accepted as a pirate, and whenever he's given something written he mindlessly gives it so she can read out loud, which makes people think he's a snob. Although all places are protected by them, they tend to stick to people's homes, shops, inns, and anything that's not being controlled by the Bandits or the Angels."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"By Laura"]]]]}
