Northern parts are covered in snowy mountains, from which a main river called flows south, passing on the edge of dense woods and a desert. "]]],[10,0],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It is surrounded by eight seas:"]]],[10,1],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Flora"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mixed-type forests with one particular in the middle of the continent - called Elysian Forest. Includes many types of mushrooms, mostly underground - some of them living. There's a tropical forest located on Raznth island."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Fauna"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Various animals and magic beasts, with following being native:"]]],[10,2],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Timeline"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Passing time is counted from the moment of a significant, albeit mysterious event called simply Great Event. A year consists of 13 months with 28 days each. Every month has 4 weeks with 7 days each:"]]],[10,3],[1,"p",[[0,[0],1,"1st Irral 0"],[0,[],0,": Great Event, a battle of gods for influence in Material Plane"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[0],1,"9th Oujy 286"],[0,[],0,": The gods prevent demons from opening a portal to the past deep in the Plane of Greed"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[0],1,"24th Wyez 336"],[0,[],0,": Elyse Allanar has been conquered by Kousherites in order to reclaim a stolen artifact called the Mask of Kousher"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[0],1,"5th Wyez 337:"],[0,[],0," Disappearance of the forest dragon Melchior, patron of the Arbor village"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[0],1,"18th Vrettan 337"],[0,[],0,": Avatar of Kousher has awoken and Silver Mountain erupted in flames, covering the Ashenland with thick layer of volcanic ash"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[0],1,"6th Avrio 341"],[0,[],0,": Revolution in Kemono Islands, the castle of Amane family captured by rebels, death of Amane Aino the daughter of highest priestess"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[0],1,"9th Denary 836"],[0,[],0,": Siegel von Blackburn returns from Kemono Islands to recolonize wilds of Ashenland and free it from influence of goblin hordes"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[0],1,"2nd Abididen 1281"],[0,[],0,": Demon-fighting order on top of Kir mountain has been destroyed by a powerful storm"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[0],1,"14th Hexad 1295"],[0,[],0,": Protests in Alisont due to abusive treatment of people with superpowers by the government, important military representative killed"]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Origin and History"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[1,1],2,"At the beginning of space and time a group of high-level beings emerged from the Void. They dreamed about creation of some lesser beings, because as we know - there are no true gods without worshippers."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[1,1],2,"Conversely, other various forces and entities that exist after The Great Event existed during this time only as floating conceptualities, akin to dust and gas clouds in the void of pre-existence. These could be entities known after The Great Event as evil beings, such as rulers and/or applicable denizens of other planes considered lesser to the post-Great Event mortal realm."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[1,1],2,"Gods had some conflict of interests, and they decided to settle it. The primordial wars a time when massive titans fought against one another for the sole reason of proving their might. These creatures were of such large size that just fragments of their elemental bodies were enough to create the world."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Of the first great beings, there were seven called Forefathers (though some of them are depicted as females) who led the other deities both in the decision to create mortals on the physical plane and in the war against the Primordials and Fiends during the Great Event. These seven are the greater gods, celestials with the most worshippers among mortals. It is unknown who the actual seventh god was, as there is no explicit mention of them in any mythology or historical texts from before the Great Event beyond some broken script saying 'Very'. So thanks to the rising influence of the cults of fire priests, this spot has recently been taken by Kousher."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Forefathers:"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Katrina, goddess of the seas"]],[[0,[],0,"Inna, goddess of law and order"]],[[0,[],0,"Murn, god of wisdom"]],[[0,[],0,"Biblios, god of books and knowledge"]],[[0,[],0,"Marshmallow, dragon god"]],[[0,[],0,"Lady of the Woods, goddess of nature"]],[[0,[],0,"Kousher, god of fire and rebirth"]],[[0,[2],1,"Verilean"]]]]]}

entries.title: Balros
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"The highest level directly under Balros is populated with Exet leaders. There's 4 of them:
* Progress
* Alakune
* Peter
* Grin"}]],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also called the Lord of Greed. Demon who incites greed in mortals by rewarding them with magic trinkets and blessings for treasures they donate to him. He stores his wealth in demonic dimension with sea of blood and golden islands. When not busy with more important stuff, he likes to contemplate all the treasures he collected while sitting on his dread throne in Plane of Greed. Likes to call himself a “God”. Valuables resting in Balros' domain are known from being affected by spreading curse. One cursed item is capable of cursing adjacent ones, with greed-themed affliction. Because of it, fate of many thieves was sealed."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Cult of Greed"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Making use of demon's tendency to reward mortals for precious goods they offer to him, a group of his followers emerged, calling themselves Exet. Its members soon grew bored of collecting the goods manually, so they persuaded more people to do the work for them - of course for a partial share in Balros' rewards. More and more people became interested in the whole procedure - it's when Exet decided to split the responsibilities into financial structure resembling pyramid, becoming Exet Corporation. Soon, the organization grew into hundreds, if not thousands involved individuals, on various hierarchy levels, with higher levels (closer to Balros) being mostly administrative, and lower levels acting as stakeholders."]]],[10,0]]}

entries.title: Kousher
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"Leaders in year 337:

Phoenix Dugo: 
Vermilion (II) Niao (III)

Red Hawks:
* Benu (III) Fenjor
* Kosh (II) Zig
* Anzu (IV) Grannir
* Boobrie (II) Lumrakas
* Garuda (I) Nogall
* Stymphalian (III) Lemwien
* Strige (II) Aly
* Liderc (V) Maric
* Cinnamologus (I) Jao
* Hoopoe (II) Elmorn"}]],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also known as God of Phoenixes, Kousher is the god of fire, retribution and phoenixes, his worshippers are primarily stationed in the northern half of Ashenland, and although he is a terrifying sight to behold, many worship him. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Once upon a time, he offered a powerful artifact to humanity, called The Face of Kousher."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Church of the Phoenix"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Unlike many religions Kousher does not require sacrifices, just loyalty and self mutilation in the form of oil baths, known to cleanse people of sin, his followers are known for being powerful fire mages and powerful warriors."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The hierarchy of the church is as follows: There are your basic Phoean, who are just ordinary worshipers. Next are the Priests - these people run a very small worship section of the massive cathedral, next are the Deacons, they are assistants to the next group, the Mangangrals, who are supposed to keep the Priests in line while running a larger section of the cathedral. Next are the Red Hawks, they have the same responsibilities as a Mangangaral but there is far less of them as they also have the duty to elect the leader of the church, otherwise known as The Phoenix Dugo. The Phoenix Dugo and Red Hawks are spiritually connected to the Kousher himself and are capable of summoning his powers. The Phoenix Dugo can make any executive decision about the church they want. As per order of the current head of Church, members of the temple routinely go on assault runs to the underworld in order to halt the spread of the ideas created by Acedia, The Demonic Prince of Sloth."]]],[10,0]]}

entries.title: Katrina
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Katrina the Storm is the goddess of the seas and the storms, being the representer of water, chaos and randomness, but also representing all the marine life. She is as old as ancient gods like Biblios or Kousher, however, she is not well known, except by the Merfolk, water Genasi and sailors."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She values those who follow her for what she represents, and not for her power. For this reason, most sailors never leave the Acsena river, since they fear not being protected from her wrath."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She never took a side in any battles during the Great Event, limiting herself to attack anyone who threatened her domain. Because of that, she survived after it, even though Kousher tried to kill her by making sure that nobody would remember her outside of the sea. However, the Merfolk and water Genasi’s worship was enough to keep her powerful."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Katrina, together with Lady of Forests and Kousher, composes what is known as the “Three Nature Gods”. This way, there is an everlasting rivalry between these three gods, and Katrina’s followers are specially capacitated to fight those who follow Kousher, thanks to the eternal rivalry between them."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Katrina can give blessings to those who follow her by adding the essence of the Storm and the Sea into their blood. This is known as the “Katrina’s Lightning”, that, once hit, inserts power into the blood. The more blessings a worshiper is granted,  the more often he needs to be struck with Katrina’s Lightning. To call one of this lightnings, the follower simply needs to pray to Katrina, though effectivity of such prayer is uncertain."]]]]}

entries.title: Murn
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He’s the god of a relatively unknown religion found in the far north. The god of guidance and life wisdom - he fulfils the duty of a fatherly archetype. He’s popular among dwarves, hermits and free-thinkers. Likes to spread his influence through Biblios, minor god of books and libraries."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He rarely interacts directly with the mortal world. Instead, he allows his followers to come to him for advice. The ultimate goal of those that follow Murn is inner peace, attained through a life's worth of discovery and wisdom. If one were to compare it to modern religion, it could be likened to a combination of modern christianity and buddhism."]]]]}

entries.title: Biblios
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Biblios is, quite simply, a God of Books. Appearing as a slender man with blue robes trimmed with gold, a book in his hand numerous pens in his leather belt, small reading spectacles and a headband with an open book icon on the front. A very studious and intelligent Deity, Biblios is always found reading or researching something. He is also quite pedantic; once he finds something he wants to know more about, no matter how trivial, he will go to great lengths to find out about it."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Biblios is a gentle, somewhat quiet Deity, rarely intervening in the lives of his followers and preferring to let them get on with their own lives. The followers of Biblios - often referred to as Bibliophiles - are incredibly studious and constantly desiring more knowledge."]]]]}

entries.title: Marshmallow
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In his natural form, Marshmallow was a massive dragon. Marshmallow is stern and very disapproving of evil. He brooks no excuses for evil acts. In spite of this, he is among the most compassionate beings in the multiverse. He has limitless empathy for the poor and helpless beings. He urges his followers to promote the cause of good, but prefers to let beings fight their own battles when they can. To Marshmallow, it is better to offer information, healing, or a (temporary) safe refuge rather than to take other’s burdens upon oneself. He usually prefers to polymorph his enemies instead of killing them."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Communion of Marshmallow"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Communion of Marshmallow is a widespread religion centered around a grounded code for being a good and just person, rather than focusing on spiritualism or the study of the world. In accordance to Marshmallow's wishes, the goal is to rid the world of evil by making as many people good as possible. Due to the low barrier of entry and the fact that the religion’s laws are based on simple moral sense and don’t require individuals to subscribe to an extreme doctrine under Marshmallow, many commoners and other regular people joined the religion when it first started. A notable trait is the fact that many reptilian races joined the Communion at inception to escape from the stigma their people had due to typically being attributed to evil gods. Many high ranking clergymen are Lizardfolk and Dragonborn."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The center of the religion is located at the Platinum Basilica, a holy city that is essentially a massive plaza made up of many different districts. The very groundwork radiates with holy energy that protects its inhabitants from unwanted forces. The religion is famed for its massive military and for having saints blessed by Marshmallow himself, following after Saint Greinbar, the Protective, an early humanoid who sat in silence for a year to commune with Marshmallow before fighting alongside the dragon and later starting up the religion. Modern saints must follow suit by spending a year in silent prayer before becoming immortalized in the religion’s history."]]]]}

entries.title: Almaris
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Almaris is the primordial deity of fate and light. He created humans with the purpose of being as adaptable and open-minded as possible - his exact reasonings vary by who's telling. Before the great event, he was married to Inna and with her created Greneire, Lord of Wrath, and a number of minor protective deities which would help to maintain law and order in the Kemono islands. His religion preaches freedom, choice, and perseverance in the face of adversity."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He acts mostly by manipulation of others. It's believed that he purposely started the great event to dispose of gods which he deemed dangerous; these included those embodying wrath, sloth, envy, among others. He banded together with the remaining gods and used their combined might to wage a war that would eventually seal away most lower gods. Viewing his actions with disgust Inna left him while his son Greneire protected those that were suddenly being attacked. Those that stood with him included few low ranking celestials that believed in what he stood for."]]]]}

entries.title: Inna
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Goddess of tradition, law and moon. She didn't fight during the Great Event and uses force against her enemies. She rewards behavior involving humaneness, benevolence and kindness."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She's said to be represented by the bigger of two moons circling over the world of Ashenland - the other being her younger sister, Katrina. Souls of Inna's followers are believed to merge with her moon upon death. Those who didn't deserve to spend the eternity with her are occasionally sent to limbo-like world on asteroid orbiting the moon."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Cult of Inna"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Inna is particularly popular among lycanthropes and other shapeshifters heavily dependent on moon's cycle. Her high priestesses usually come from Kemono Islands. She's also recognized among people of conservative viewpoints."]]]]}

entries.title: Viole
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Viole is the patron deity of envy and reform - seeking to overthrow those in the underworld and to one day reclaim her place as a surface deity. She serves under Greneire, Lord of Wrath and maintains all of the cities which he's conquered, providing direction to them and turning them into semi-capitalist meritocracies. Those at the bottom are spiteful, those at the top hate the ones above them and step on those below them. Far better than a nation led by orcs, though."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She is worshipped by some in the nation of Greneire, but remains largely too weak to maintain her own existence - the only one keeping her alive is her father, Greneire, who spends much of his own life force to keep her as such. Even so she still only has the form of a child."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Appearance"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She looks like a teenage girl, around 14 or so years of age, although still inhumanly beautiful regardless. Blonde hair, white dress, golden eyes. Radiates white light, usually unarmed. She often shape changes and takes on different forms in order to manipulate events to her liking. While most of the kings of Greneire's systems might think that they got to the top on their own strength and merit, a good number were really just puppets which Viole would possess and use to control the nation domestically herself, taking over them during crucial points of decision. She's been controlling the conquered nations of Greneire for 254 years, although her father is aware of this."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Personality"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Despite her righteous goal Viole is incredibly petty and hates most of those above her. She seeks to constantly expand her influence as a result, believing that she could do a better job ruling than most of the gods that do rule over their lands. Her wisdom is mostly tactical, and she's masterful when it comes to planning things through and manipulating circumstances; She inherited most of her personality from her father, but kept her grandfathers wit and mindset."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"History"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She was born before the great event and was the motherless daughter of Greneire. Because she was born while Greneire was still a righteous soul serving justice, she was born as a light deity, the same as he was. She carries many of the ideals held by her grandfather as a result of this."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Almaris foresaw the fall of Greneire and so asked of his daughter that she would fall alongside him and serve him in the underworld. Believing that she would spend her existence facing and defeating evil, and that she would one day return to the surface, she accepted and fell to the underworld."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She was taken as the bride of Balros, Lord of Greed in the year 354 After Great Event - for political reasons."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Cult of Viole"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Cults of Viole are largely Almarisian in nature - she's largely unknown in the underworld even in the places that she protects because of her role as a light goddess. To follow her is heresy in the underworld, and any found guilty of it would be summarily exiled. Underworld cults dedicated to Viole often focus on subtly reforming the nations which they rise up in. They have incredibly little political power, but by sheer luck have done some good throughout history."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"On the surface she's a minor figure and only mentioned in some prayers by the followers of Almaris; being seen as a martyr for heading into the underworld. She's celebrated one week a year by people of Alisont."]]]]}

entries.title: Greneire
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The deity of bloodshed and vengeance, Greneire is the patron deity and creator of orc-kind. He's the son of Almaris, and a former god of justice. After falling his position as god of justice was taken by his son Aslaug. Not much is known about his fall and transformation into an archfiend, other than that it occurred during the great event. He wears a bloodied suit of armor, and his eyes are made of pure white light. His original form had mechanical armor, but newer depictions often depict him without it. He appears more like a hulking mass of muscle and sinew, skinless and ever-raging."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Domains and Doctrines"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Greneire reigns supreme over the Circle of Wrath, and reigns over the domains of war, life, and vengeance. He's also said to be originator of blood magic. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"His doctrines focus partially on solidarity. He encourages violent and often destructive ways of moving towards a given goal; And his followers often have an animalistic 'Survival of the Fittest' mentality. The strong rule the weak. Although the dynamics can change at any time based on who's strongest."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Greneire seeks conquest of the underworld and subsequently to lead his armies up to the surface in order to kill his father. His followers are a constant nuisance to other residents of the underworld and they seem to be unending in supply. As many believe - killing one gives rise to 2 others. They've been known to hold onto grudges for centuries."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"His followers are in constant combat with those that follow Almaris. They believe the Alisonians to be cowards and weaklings, and thus deserving of immediate subjugation."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Nations of Wrath"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The nations of wrath are a series of states ruled over by Greneire within the underworld. there are 5 different nations among them, and they often fight amongst themselves. While their god is savage most of those at home live lives working to fund the war, and have a functioning economy driven by merit. Greneire reigns over a huger circle than many of the other demonic gods, having conquered the territory of envy 200 years after the great event. Although the industrial part largely maintains the culture of envy, the outer parts are more akin to a bunch of warring tribes constantly killing each other and adding to the armies of dirges. The dirges don't come back after dying. There's just so many of them that killing any single dirge has no effect on their overall number."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The inner nation is defined by frustration and spite. It's a highly productive meritocracy which relies on a powerful and effective government to thrive. While the people in it aren't happy, they're most certainly healthy and educated enough to get done what's asked of them, and there is a level of entertainment. But the majority of them spend their lives expanding industries, developing technologies, or performing similar tasks."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Outside of that is a world of constant combat where all those living within exist purely for war. From birth they're taught to kill to survive. The weak are rooted out, and the strong rule. The war creates an environment where all existing therein are incredibly strong, and the weak, while less fit, are used as cannon fodder in Greneire's armies. The wars create an economy within the inner circles, forcing them into constant work. The tactics used within this circle have been known to use staggering levels of complexity, and have evolved to levels unseen in other circles. Because of the training that they endure, the orcs are well disciplined, highly trained warriors. They're trained in guerrilla warfare, can survive off of barely anything for weeks on end, and survive wounds that would kill lesser men. Full orcs are often killed off or used as breeding horses and servants in order to produce the much more effective half orcs which dominate battlefields. The villages can sustain themselves to an extent, and the blessings of Greneire allow them to devour the people they fight for sustenance. The war serves as a breeding ground for Dirges, where all that die are transformed. While soldiers might lose wit during the transformation, they gain strength, undying loyalty and a number of useful abilities that make them more practical for use, like not needing to eat or drink to survive."]]]]}

entries.title: Melzaboul
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A demon lord from hellish dimension. He’s an efreet which has discovered a way of increasing his power by extracting and manipulating mortal souls. He's said to serve a greater, unknown yet evil."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He has an expanding group of followers, which he calls his children. Many of them are Soul Tieflings created from various pacts with mortals, with most notable one being tiefling Ceciline Brandy. Melzaboul often rewards his followers for tricking mortals into selling their souls to him."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In year 336 he has imprisoned soul of a powerful warlock named Aniphar Kane, after Adaris, ruler of Elysian Forest, sentenced him to death."]]]]}

entries.title: Beast of Hunger
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Sometimes referred to as Ozzy, a primordial entity from Plane of Hunger, being the embodiment of annihilation. Is fond of devouring other beings and is seemingly acting all by itself."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Appearance"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Beast manifests itself as twisted cloud of dark matter, sharing properties of both gas and liquid. Its appearance is always accompanied by eerie tone resembling modified human's call. It's amorphous, capable of taking any shape and fitting into any space (even into a crevice of closed door). The victims which got themselves into the cloud's range are said to feel extreme pain - shortly before being disassembled into tiny particles, absorbed by the Beast."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Personality"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It shows signs of sentience - witnesses tell the stories where the Beast sometimes changed its decision on whether to devour, or not to devour some particular character - after being simply spoken to. It's visibly attracted to important figures, places and/or events."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"History"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Once upon a time, a necromancer named Kunbothe attempted to summon and successfully tame the Beast to some degree and use it as guard to his tomb, in abandoned underground temple. Thus, the Beast has been nicknamed Ozzy - mostly because of its ooze-like appearance. Unfortunately, sometime in year 237 the result came out to be merely accidental, as the Beast suddenly woke up from its slumber after the temple was visited by powerful demon - Balros, Lord of Greed. This event started Beast's rampage all over the Underworld, attracted by closest sources of power. At some point, it was lured by interdimensional rift created by another demon - Melzaboul, Lord of Souls. In the middle of a battle involving gods, demons and mortals brewing around it, the Beast was known to devour couple of individuals before attempting to reach the rift with its shadow tentacles. The attempt was stopped by the gods, which with help of mortals managed to seal the rift in last attempt of saving the space-time continuity. The Beast hasn't been seen since the battle took place."]]]]}

entries.title: Juteus Azra
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Juteus is the god of perfection, poison, and degradation. He was a twin god, born alongside his sister, Azra. He is currently a fiendish lord of the Abyss and is especially worshipped by cults from reptilian races and whoever they manage to indoctrinate."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Originally, they were both humans who sought ascension to perfection and worked together to assimilate the reptilian form, going from human to reptile to monster to god. Some tribes of snake people worship them as the first of their kind, while some of their more skeptical brethren insist that they were simply the most successful of their kind. But all snake people agree on one thing; Azra was a traitor to her people. She did not pity or hate those who were different from her. After attaining perfection, she looked at lesser beings and sympathized with them. Cared for them. Wished to coexist with them. And it was disgusting. Disgusting enough that her brother had to do what was right and devour her whole. He, a god of degradation, swallowed the goddess of poison, and they became the god of perfection in their worshippers' eyes."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Unfortunately, this meant that many snake people still shared some of Azras foolishness in them. Usually, they resembled humans more than they resembled snakes. Every once in a while, they would pop up in the genealogy and Juteus Azra would rightly punish them with a cruel immortality. The Azra kin would feel pain and suffering like all living things, but they would always return after death to continue their suffering. There was no relief in death, just more pain to be had. Their corpse would rise, their heart would beat, and their soul would rot, chipping away bit by bit from the cruel stress. And Juteus would laugh all the while, reminding the victim that its all their fault for sharing the same idiocy as his sister."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"During the Great Event, Juteus participated out of morbid curiosity, using his cunning and manipulative tactics to find out just how many gods and titans he could get away with killing. Supposedly, the number surprised even him. "]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Cult of Juteus"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He also has worshippers among other reptilian races, such as lizard people and kobolds. He has a hobby of sewing further chaos among the denizens of the Abyss, manipulating events to a result he prefers. Juteus asks a lot of his followers in exchange for power and perfection, likely because he likes the control, and he commonly demands ritual sacrifices. The cult is popular among some individuals among other races, usually serial killers and the insane. Bermia Shallour, a wealthy human noblesse, was suspected to have murdered over a hundred servants, homeless people, and other wanderers over the course of a decade all in the name of Juteus."]]]]}

entries.title: Mnemophorsis
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Goddess of the arcane parts of the Underworld, Mnemophorsis is a notorious accepting yet impassive diety. Shes respected as the goddess of Spite, Criticism, and Rhetoric. Shes mostly worshipped by the outcasts among Elysian Forest beings, such as those with mixed blood, those cursed into twisted forms, transformed creatures, various monsters, and even Half-Elves."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The supernatural of Underworld are strange creatures where a generally good creature would be considered flighty and neutrally unpredictable by normal standards. The creatures of the arcane Underworld are only slightly different from their forest brethren, equally twisted, monstrous, grotesque, and mutated. They werent always like this; they were simply arcane forest creatures that didnt live up to the standards of the more beautiful inhabitants and were fiercely ostracized for it over the course of decades. They were snubbed, mocked, and avoided by beautiful fairies, dryads, and nymphs for centuries, which bred ugly emotions of darkness, resentment, spite, and self-loathing. This, combined with the magical energy of the forest that surrounded them changed their bodies to conform to their insides, exacerbating the problem while the other remained beautiful, elitist, and superior in attitude."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Most of the forest gods encouraged, participated in, and perpetuated this elitism, being that they stood at the pinnacle of the aesthetic. But a solitary deity among them objected, insisting that treating the ugly as lower class was ridiculous. Mnemophorsis believed that everyone deserved a home, regardless of how ugly or how mixed their blood may be. She composed many songs and poems centered around this idea, the lyrics and melody inspired by the ugly creatures. For as long as shed been around, her artwork was usually adored and enjoyed by everyone, though she never cared about the popularity. She worked her way up the chain of popularity in order to get her message heard, whatever it may be, but it was usually ignored as the forest dwellers took what they liked from her work and ignored all the complicated stuff. And it happened again. No matter how hard Mnemophorsis tried to get the others to see things her way, no matter how much she argued and tried to force people to change their mind using logic and emotion, no one listened."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Eventually she stormed away, leaving the beautiful lands of the Elysian Forest while screaming and cursing her peers for their stupidity, claiming to pity them for suffering the curse of being wrong, as always, and delved into the Underworld. As she crossed the border, her form changed to something much like the half-breeds and mutated creatures she stood up for, becoming rough and scaly in some parts, covered in fungi and moss all over, puss oozing from random areas, and her features twisting into something out of a nightmare. She was welcomed into the Underworld as a queen and as the one who gives those with nowhere else to go somewhere to belong. She accepts any and all arcane creatures to her lush, mushroomy parts of Underworld, no matter how ugly, mutated, or diluted their lineage might be, as opposed to the Elysian Forest that only accepts the graceful purebloods and the acceptably pretty people they favor. However, it quickly becomes apparent that in believing no one is special, Mnemophorsis staunchly refuses to give special treatment. No family, no close friends, no loyal followers; no one is special to her. They are all equally terrible creatures, much like the beautiful forest creatures, with bad taste and a habit for being wrong about things. So she, whose opinion is the right one, deserves to be in control as a matter of course. In public, she wears the guise of her original fantastical and beautific form that competes with even the prettiest in the forest, though she makes no effort to keep her true nightmarish appearance a secret. Shes the goddess of Spite, Criticism, and Rhetoric."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"One fact kept hidden by the overworld is that the Lady of Air and Darkness was once one of the original Muses, the most talented celebrities idolized by forest society for their beauty, artistic skills, and other enamoring nature. The representatives of Elysian Forest now pretend that the new muse they replaced her with was always the original one and spread credit for Mnemophorsis contributions to society to other forest inhabitants who felt they were more deserving of the fame; a fact that still frustrates and angers Mnemophorsis to the point of extreme violence."]]]]}

entries.title: Dargollan
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Minor demon, working his way up through slave trade, operating between many demonic planes, with Plane of Lust serving as his former hub. Has couple of other, even lesser fiends under control as well as a few warlocks that made a pact with him. Among many of his partnerships, one with a lich named Kunbothe was the most notable - in exchange for lich's services, Dargollan was offering him his slaves for experiments."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In year 236, his manor was raided by law enforcement of the Plane of Lust. In the process of the raid they took into custody a dozen warlocks and a few other fiends. When they made their way into the basement they discovered many young succubi (among them his slave secretary, Lustrous Tiefling named Gadreel) that were being held and undergoing the process of training to be sold off to other fiends or be given to faithful warlocks as a form of pact gift. The succubi were taken to a safe place, cleaned up, and given time to readjust to a life out of chains."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Unfortunately, Dargollan himself managed to run away. Not having the jurisdiction to track down those who were outside the Plane of Lust, lustral forces unfortunately could do nothing but to simply take note of names of Dargollan's henchmen who have escaped together with their boss - in case they ever showed themselves here."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Deprived of his most talented followers, he accepted an offer from the Drow living in bottom parts of Plane of Greed. Being a lesser demon, he was still powerful enough to be recognized as an influential business partner - even by the Demon Lords, like Melzaboul, Lord of Souls. According to elven plan, he would have to convince Melzaboul into a true symbiosis - the great enslavement of the mortal souls - both physical, and spiritual. Additionally, the Drow promised him the legendary Throne of Greed abandoned earlier by its former owner and creator - Balros, Lord of Greed. With Dargollan on the Throne, backed by even more powerful Melzaboul, the Drow and the allied Duergar would be finally able to take over Agmeth, town of Greed, for themselves..."]]]]}

entries.title: Gregor Havicken
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mirfield village's mayor in year 336. As a merchant, he is owner of a local general store. From time to time he replenishes his supplies by organizing caravan courses between Mirfield and the capital city Alisont. He was almost killed by orcs when his caravan was ambushed on the road. Luckily, orcs were defeated by adventurers travelling with Gregor. Later on, the same group of adventurers stole his wagon and horses in Alisont."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Appearance"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mid-aged man with grizzled hair and tanned skin. His hands are big and rough, and bear many scars from his laborious past."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Personality"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Conservative and lawful, tries to minimize risks of his industry - whenever it's possible. He's a proficient negotiator and salesman - he often uses these skills to deal with other people."]]]]}

entries.title: Korvis von Blackburn
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A cousin to the dwarven king of Silvermount. In year 336, he took up a position of kingdom's Steward, representing the king, whose health condition was said to gradually detriment. As revealed later, the real king was already dead and buried in the caves deep under the city."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He was responsible for creation of penal labor camp in Silvermount and developing a system of importing prisoners from various places across the whole Ashenland. Though controversial, his work has established a major part of future wealth of the Socialistic Party of the Dwarves."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"During prisoners' chase, he and his squad followed the escapees down under the Silver Mountain, where together with fire priests of Kousher they fought against an ambush of dark elves and dark dwarves alliance. Together with the prisoners, he was teleported away from the danger to Kemono Islands, moments before the Silver Mountain erupted in flames when the ambush got to its finale."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Later on, he used his financial knowledge to gain trust of one of the Kemono families and become the court accountant."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He had a grandson named Siegel."]]]]}

entries.title: Bogath Uluskel
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"One of the most powerful wizards in the whole Ashenland (as he states). He is often involved in the main storyline. Driven by his own sense of justice, which sometimes helps adventurers, and sometimes not so much. A proficient cook - pumpkin cookies are his speciality."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He was asked for help during the mysterious sickness incident in Mirfield. He decided to summon groups of random adventures from far lands, to help him with investigations. After issue was resolved, he disappeared for a while."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He saved his pupils from death by hanging in order to investigate another major threat hidden deep in Elysian Forest."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"To escape death by warlock Aniphar Kane, he decided to drink a “Potion of Invisibility”, which has permanently reduced his size to a small, hand-sized man. So far he was unsuccessful in regaining previous form."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Appearance"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Tiny-sized old man with disarrayed gray hair and long, belt-length beard. Despite his visibly advanced age, he maintains straight body when walking. Usually wears black robes. When venturing to harsh lands, he takes his wooden stick with him. After his size was altered, he relies on his servant Grag - animated plate armor, which helmet was transformed into a cockpit."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Personality"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"He's thoughtful and proactive in reaching his controversial goals, but is indifferent towards other people. He easily withstands lack of social interactions, with nose buried in books and scrolls. He often talks to himself - that's how he maintains his eloquence in time of isolation. When things don't go according to his plans, he slowly starts being grumpy."]]]]}

entries.title: Ignvarros Visncendo
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A powerful sorcerer with a passion for the element of fire. As a youngster, he showed magical talents. The family could not cope with his insubordination and magic. They decided to banish his son after he had burnt his own house inadvertently. Traveling without a penny, he was noticed by a mysterious magician who saw potential in it. That's how he spent in youth in the guild of magicians, where he stood out with his talents. He met Gabriel Consarmounion here. Despite his talents, he is chaotic and selfish. During the study of magic he became interested in spells of forbidden and alchemical substances affecting the nervous system. Which contributed to getting him out of the school of magic. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Before year 337, he lead a secret organization, where he was commissioned by highly placed people. He does what they can not do. Performing various orders, he is characterized by intelligence, charisma, influence and ruthlessness. Being chaotic and evil in his nature, he tends to be elusive and untouchable. It happens that you can meet him in brothels, where he likes to play with young ladies. It is also known that he is addicted to drugs..."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In year 337 he was hired by wizard Bogath Uluskel to help in investigation of mysterious source of power in dungeon of ruined tower in Elysian Forest."]]]]}

entries.title: Gabriel Consarmounion
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Talented wizard excelling in water magic. A brilliant magician who is characterized by intelligence and life wisdom. In his youth, he grew up on a farm. He learned the hardships of life in this way. Thanks to his hard work on the farm he became a humble and patient man. He knows that in order to achieve the goal, he needs successive hard work. His parents called him a stoic child, even a celestial child. Because of his inner peace and trouble-free upbringing. Once upon a time, his parents saw a heavenly glow around him. They considered it a miracle they decided to offer him to the monastery of Murn, high in the mountains. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Soon after, it turned out that it was his magical talent that caused this effect and he was transferred from the monastery to the guild of mages. There he studied the magical arts perfectly and studied his ropes, he was one of the most talented students. It's where he met Ignvarros Visncendo with whom he always competed for being the best. Eventually he won thanks to this he became the best mage and started giving advice to the highest placed people across the continent. He is characterized by knowledge, stoic calmness, excellent assessment of the situation and intelligence. He often prays in a monastery."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In year 337 he was hired by wizard Bogath Uluskel to help in investigation of mysterious source of power in dungeon of ruined tower in Elysian Forest."]]]]}

entries.title: Kobba
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"An exceptionally big man born in Alisont in 1276 After Great Event, afflicted with a rare disease causing skin calcification."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"His mother was an electrical engineer, and tried to teach him her ways, but Kobba quickly became twice as big as a normal child at his age. His big fingers, in pair with stiff, stone-like skin, rendered him unable to do a precision work. It's why his mother decided to send him to help on his grandfather's farm to make for his living and costly medical examinations of clueless doctors."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Years passed, as Kobba has been living on the farm, away from the big city, not worried by his former school bullies anymore. Soon he grew into a nervous man actively avoiding new contacts due to his negative past experiences."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After reaching his twenties, he received a proposition from one of his former doctors to take part in healthcare programme sponsored by the government, taking place in Wonders Wing hospital. At first, it looked like a normal, medical examination - but soon after, he was basically imprisoned in the hospital's underground facility, owned by Scientific Analysis of Energy Origin project. He was unwillingly led through dozens of experiments designated to discover supernatural traces in the cause of his stone-skin condition."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The scientists once again proved themselves to be clueless, not only wasting Kobba's time but his sanity as well. The final diagnosis was the same as before - a cancer-like, genetic mutation of deep skin cells."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Frustrated Kobba, sitting in his reinforced cell, was soon visited by a group of adventurers trying to sabotage the facility and free its test subjects. Seeing such opportunity, he decided to join them and bring justice to unethical scientists. Together, they discovered a huge portal, from which a group of deadly robots spawned and took over the lab. With help of the chief scientist, Chaddwick Blinckus, they reconfigured the portal to go back in time in order to prevent the robots from being summoned in the first place."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Once he jumped about dozen years into the past, he accidentally interfered with a woman which was his mother's friend. After that encounter, he simply disappeared. It's been said it lead to circumstances, where he had never entered the portal - ultimately erasing the older version of himself from the past."]]]]}

entries.title: The Crimson Bears
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A gang founded in 1295 and run by married couple of gangsters - Felix and Alexandra (respectively 41 and 35 years old at the time of founding). The gang’s name was chosen after their daughter Zima’s bearlike ears, that where passed down from her mother, and her favourite colour being red. The gang is centred to the west of the Alisont city and that has been living off selling stolen or illegal weapons, which are always in high demand."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This gang is pretty small compared to the local gangs because of it being relatively new and being mostly family-related, However, it has one of the best strike teams by far and it has become known after heist in a high-tech industry storage unit. After many gangs tried and failed to break through their almost military level defences, Zima’s strike team, after some losses, was able to secure few prototypes - what earned respect and hate from other gang leaders. With Zima as the tactical captain, she was able to complete missions that were seen as impossible, even if some of her friends lost their life. This was something that annoys other gangs and still does until today."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"However, one thing never changed and it was that her father Felix was the mind of the operations. And his wife Alexandra was never really involved, Not carrying much for the inner dealings of the gang, trying to raise a good young girl that was Zima."]]]]}

entries.title: Blood of Almaris
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Blood of Almaris is an extremist cult which glorifies martyrdom, penitence, and justice. They believe that only in suffering can one be righteous, and as a result they constantly strive to serve those around them and to extinguish the fires of evil. The cult itself is from the martyrs sect of worship, but follows a doctrine deemed extreme even by others of their faith."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"They have an ire for almost all other faiths, not because of their morals but because of how soft they are and for their weakness in failing to always follow through with their beliefs. No penitence is enough- Those who would follow any other faith are impure and lack devotion. Purity is of utmost value to those who worship the blood, and no crime should ever go unpunished. However, they also believe in forgiveness - if you’re ever captured by them, and if you allow yourself to be converted after many weeks whipping and torture, you can be forgiven and allowed to live. No crime is too great for redemption."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In this way they’re similar to those who follow the great phoenix Kousher. However, while Kousher does encourage penitence and ‘rebirth’, his teachings don’t go nearly as far in the quest for purity. If you bathe in burning oil regularly as a kousherite you’ll be free of sin. For one who follows the bloody and beaten path of redemption, however, there can be no respite. Those who follow the cult of blood shall suffer for their entire lives in the hopes of purging all evil and impurity from their souls. The lives of the truly devout are living hells made possible by the faithful. There can be no rest for the wicked. They’re absolute lunatics, and they seek to impose this martyrdom onto others as well."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Around year 1295, the cult has given birth to a number of Alisont's gangs which wear their heraldry and seek to induct others into their faith - mainly the lowest of criminals roaming the streets by the methods mentioned previously. These are a heinous lot- They often involve themselves in politics by hunting down corrupt officials and torturing them into confessing for crimes they may or may not have ever committed - regardless of whether not they truly did anything wrong, there is no future for them after that. The followers of the cult believe that Almaris guides their hand, and that all they’ve brought to justice deserved were genuinely guilty. Although the police would ordinarily crush such a lot immediately after learning their antics, they’ve been allowed to stay in order to deal with the massive criminal uprisings springing up around Ashenland. Because of the nature of their faith they don’t ordinarily commit crimes aside from capturing and torturing criminals, and most of those they targeted were almost guaranteed to be guilty. Further, they have no centralized command, making it next to impossible to quickly and effectively deal with them. They’re looked at with a mixture of awe and disgust by others."]]]]}

entries.title: Taruraj
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"\"Shall the petty beings who believe themselves superior based upon their own lack of potency fall before my blade\" - Taruraj Mantra"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Taruraj was a conquest group of nomadic Goblins and related species founded in year 337 in Tonnis by Warlord Dober, with the goal to advance Goblinkind to a civilized state. They did this by conquering small cities and villages and devoting them to their own followers. The Taruraj conquered many towns in the name of their flag, mostly spanning the Elysian coast and parts of the desert. In the past, they have commenced numerous raids on nearby (mostly Human) cities like Alisont and Ketu. They have also experience in maritime piracy, often using makeshift rafts to board target ships."]]]]}

entries.title: The Peng Clan
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Currently, it is known as one of the strongest and wealthiest clans in the continent who try to uphold justice across it against the various monstrosities present in it. "]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"History"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Its start dates to thousands of years ago when their founder, a weasel who running away from a wolf ended up falling into a volcano. While falling, it barely managed to hold off into a cave in its interior just before it touched the lava below. Still, with the heat of the volcano, its fur started to burn, and so, it headed further into the cave trying to stay alive. In there, it found a red pill, not like it knew what it was, but it was lucky enough to swallow the pill. And being that it was one of the supreme elemental pills, the supreme fire pill, a pill that came to be when fire and heat came to exist in the current universe, it not only gave him immunity to fire and heat, but it allowed it to absorb them to strengthen himself."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It was unknown how such a precious treasure of heaven and earth was brought into this cave, but, due to it, the weasel managed to absorb all the lava and heat in that volcano in ten years, and so, it was nearly reborn where it had grasped the ability to control fire along with gaining a humanoid body. His fur and hair became red due to the over abundance of fire elemental energy in his body, and perhaps as a result of his cultivation, he gained both intelligence and awareness of himself. And so, the first thing that he did was slaughter the hundreds of wolves that lived nearby in revenge followed by his journey around the world where he absorbed the energy of various places and met many people. In that journey, he became widely known as the Immortal Peng, a hero who would defeat all evils of this world. After around a hundred years of cultivation, Peng got married to a red-haired woman he fell in love with, and so was the start of the Peng clan. In the following five hundred years, the clan grew bigger till it was composed of almost 100 people and being that they were all taught how to cultivate from Peng himself, their clan managed to become one of the strongest ones in existence. With it producing many generations of heroes who managed to obtain the trust of many countries in the continent, it quickly became one of the most affluent clans too."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Crisis"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"But, around 1000 years after Peng started to cultivate, an ancient evil deity awakened, and seeing 3 out of 5 of his direct sons and daughters dying while fighting it, he sacrificed himself to seal said deity for all of eternity. Now, a few thousands of years after these events happened, the Peng clan has grown to contain thousands of members and various branches across the continent, it was even rumored that they managed to spread to different continents. Still, its greatest strength came from the main Peng clan, the ones who had the purest blood and yang affinities and the ones who managed to reach the highest levels of cultivation.  Not only that, but the main clan itself was being protected by hundreds of thousands of years old elders who spent most of their time hibernating and cultivating in isolation for when it was their time to sacrifice themselves for the clan. Being led by the direct daughter of the Immortal Peng, Meili Peng, the only direct descendent who was still alive, the council of elders was also responsible for looking over the seal that Peng had made. In recent days, their worries have been increasing lately as the seal was starting to show small instabilities in between the years."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Still, the council of elders was something that most people in the continent werent aware of, even some of the members of the Peng clan werent fully aware of them, instead, the reigning patriarch was known to be leader of the whole clan, a position taken by the strongest of those born in the current generation and a position that was inherited by a new leader every 200 years. Currently, the leader was Zheng Peng, the youngest son of Meili Peng, and one of the most talented man to ever exist in the clan. After reaching 50 years old, he was already stronger than all of those who had yet to reach a thousand years old, and as so, he was one of the youngest descendants to ever become a leader. Right now, he has barely passed 100 years old, but even though his strength only continued to increase, his stress was also increasing with it due to his exiled son Da Peng who instead of attempting to atone for his sins, chose to commit evil acts to break through the seals he had placed on him. And even though he wanted to destroy those who imprisoned his son afterwards, he held himself back. After all, he knew his son deserved to be imprisoned and even killed for what he had done. Due to that, he has been severing his emotions to fully focus on leading the clan and grooming his second son and his two daughters, as he hopes that his eldest son will one day repent."]]]]}

"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"Sample things that cause little to no imbalance: * Changing items to different items of the same total cost * Changing damage type to different damage type * Changing language to different language * Changing proficiency to different proficiency of the same type * Changing spell to a different spell of the same level * Changing racial trait to analogous trait from other race"}],["html",{"html":"
"}],["hr",{}]],"markups":[["strong"],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/races.html"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/classes.html"]],["a",["href","https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0Qx4NeOkTzTZ2lrT2JoeUxQclU/view"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bhtnbhfNfO4"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RH2fJYTG664"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ge3VLq9bv8k"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/backgrounds.html"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/items.html"]],["a",["href","https://ashenland.azurewebsites.net/gameplay-guide"]]],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"1. Concept"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.1 Seven-word description"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to invent bunch of characters, which can be described in exactly 7 words. Think of character's most distinctive features. It's a quick method of researching possible options. Share them with other players and Dungeon Master in order to validate them and refine the best idea. They may suggest you some technical details. Example concepts:"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Curious human fighting with bow and sword"]],[[0,[],0,"Strong, but dumb half-orc with pet turtle"]],[[0,[],0,"Lich trying to find cure for undeath"]]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.2 Entertain yourself..."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Primarily, the character should bring you entertainment. If you're new to roleplaying, you might want to develop a character which matches your personality - during the game you will just need to be yourself. If you prefer to be someone else, try choosing a character which resembles some character from movie, video game or book."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.3 ... entertain other players"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Apart from being interesting to you, your character should provide visible and interesting ways of interaction with other players' characters."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.4 ... entertain DM"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Believe or not, DM wants to have some fun, too. Define some background, goals and problems which haunt your character, so that DM will be able to bind your character with the campaign's story."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"2. Sheet"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.1 Get the sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you have no assigned sheet yet, you can grab free emergency sheet available in Journal tab. If there's no spare sheet, ask DM to create one for you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Use game's Compendium ("i" tab on the right) to search for most of the things listed in the next steps (like items and spells) and drag&drop them to your character sheet. They will serve you as a reference for preparing good descriptions. For the world's lore reference, you can look at this blog's entries. You can also see a sample character in Journal tab."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to pick some climatic name for your character."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.2 Attributes"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You start on level 1. Roll your ability scores. You have 6 Ability scores to assign scores to (in any order): Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. You can either roll 4 6-sided die and record the cumulative total of the highest 3 dice 6 times (type #stats in chat to use macro for it) or take the “standard set” which is 15,14,13,12,10,8, or alternatively, make a point buy according to D&D rule. You do not need to assign these scores yet, but you can if you want to. If you think your rolls were weak, you can try to bargain with DM."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.3 Race"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Decide the race of your character. You can find all the available races "],[0,[1],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each race has racial traits that affect your ability scores, skills checks, speed and/or proficiencies. This means that certain races are better suited for certain classes, but you can play as who you want. Write down the character’s race traits under the traits/features section of the character sheet."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.4 Class"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Now decide the class. You can find the classes "],[0,[2],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each class has a starting gear (which will be explained in 2.8), primary stat, hit die (which max value + your constitution bonus gives you your max hit points on level 1), saving throw proficiencies, armor and weapons proficiencies. You can find each of these on the class page. You will want to write these down on the bottom left of the character sheet. You will also want to look at the features your class has. Each class starts with features at level one and will gain access to more as they level up. Write down the character’s level one class features under the traits/features section of the character sheet. Also write down your overall proficiency bonus (if it wasn't previously automatically calculated by the sheet). If your class defines list of spells you can choose from, add the chosen ones in spells section. You can also pick spells converted from D&D 3.5e from "],[0,[3],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ensure all your traits/features/attacks/spells are properly described by clicking them in your sheet and observing chat output. Set each spell to show full description (instead of shortened one) - if you show reduced description during session, DM will ask you to show full anyway."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.5 Alignment"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Define your character's moral compass. This way DM can say, what sort of emotion will a given event induce in your character. Also, some magical artifacts require to be attuned to person of specific alignment. Here's a three-part guide to alignments: "],[0,[4],1,"Good"],[0,[],0,", "],[0,[5],1,"Neutral"],[0,[],0,", "],[0,[6],1,"Evil"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.6 Background"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Now you will want to decide on a background. Who was your character before now? The list of backgrounds is "],[0,[7],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each background offers extra proficiencies and a feature, amongst other things. After choosing a background, you are supposed to roll dice to see which traits you acquire, but if you want you can pick them without rolling (or invent your own, providing it's 1-2 sentences long). The choice is yours. Write down the chosen personality, ideal, bond, flaw, proficiencies, features, languages, items and anything else your background provides you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's important to aggregate all weapon proficiencies into one, armor proficiencies into another one, language proficiencies into yet another one - when DM asks players to show, for instance, language proficiencies, four players clicking every language separately will make quite a mess in the chat."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.7 Biography"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have your character's race, class and background, feel inspired to include some story fluff. Unlike most of D&D campaigns, this campaign is being ran in player-created world. What drives your character? Why did he/she start adventuring? Add at least short character biography to your sheet ("Character Sheet" -> "Bio" tab), in which you can define some people, monsters, lands, towns, characters and artifacts, which should appear in the world along with your own character. Because this description is accessible to other players, everything what appears here will be considered as something your character is willing to tell (or already told) about to his/her friends."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also think about a description in "Bio & Info" tab of your sheet - it's the only part of your sheet which can be seen by other players. Make sure it's concise - so that DM won't need to dig through pages of all the flavorful info to get to the core of your character's backstory (alternatively, you can put the most important parts in bold). It can be the same as your public biography in "Bio" tab, but perhaps your character has some secrets which can't go public?"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Define your character's sidequests as well. There should be two of them - can be separate, or bound together in a common goal. Describe them concisely somewhere in your private biography, so that DM can easily deduce on what condition your character should gain extra levels (one level per each sidequest)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.8 Items"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Next are weapons, armor and miscellaneous items. On your class page there's predetermined equipment that you can choose from (sometimes they are provided by Background, too). You can find all basic equipment "],[0,[8],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Alternatively, instead of taking class items, you can buy any items you want, after rolling starting wealth from following table:"]]],[10,0],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have chosen your armor you will calculate your Armor Class. Your armor class is the armor rating + your dexterity bonus. Light armor allows full Dexterity Bonus, Medium armor only allows a +2 Dexterity Bonus, and Heavy armor allows no Dexterity Bonus. If you decide to go without the armor, your AC will be 10 + your dexterity bonus at default. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Remember to set item weights in the sheet - it will be used to determine encumbrance and overall character's weight."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.9 Attacks"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The last thing will be to add attacks your character can perform (if they weren't automatically added after you dragged&dropped weapons/spells to your sheet). Weapons refer to physical weapons such as a sword or bow. For these your attack bonus will be your strength modifier (melee) or dexterity modifier (ranged) + your proficiency bonus. Damage is what is listed on the weapon page + your Strength (or Dexterity, in case of Finesse weapons) modifier. Spell attacks are a bit more complex and you should rely on drag&drop method (otherwise, you need to set its damage and/or saving throws manually)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.10 Homebrew"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If the whole presented D&D content is still somehow not enough for you - you can try to design your own, custom elements. In order to make your creations mechanically balanced, try to find some existing reference from official source book - like spell, item, race, class (classes are especially difficult to balance, so if you don't want to waste hours or days of your and DM's life, stick to some smaller detail that makes you unique), and then adapting it. Use list below as homebrewing guideline."]]],[10,1],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"3. Token"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you want a custom character token, you can find one by googling "rpg top down token" (must have transparent background!). You can also search by author's name - Devin Night usually makes quite good ones. Send token's link to DM. If you provide no token, DM will pick one for you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Here's how the tokens should look like:"]]],[10,2],[10,3],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It seems your character is ready. You can now proceed to the "],[0,[9],1,"Gameplay Guide"],[0,[],0," to learn how to play efficiently."]]]]}

The Setup"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have prepared your character (using "],[0,[1],1,"Character Creation Guide"],[0,[],0,"), you can now proceed to prepare yourself for upcoming session."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],2,"1.1 Fill the "],[0,[],0,"Upcoming "],[0,[0,0],3,"Session Poll"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's a set of Discord messages which appear in #upcoming-sessions channel. Mark your times. There can be up to two sessions each weekend. Both of them need at least 3 core players who voted green and at most 5 players in total. Final squads will be reassigned, so that each player who voted should play at least one session. In case someone will need to be moved in order to create two balanced squads, there's a default priority (first by color, then by ascending number of voted days)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.2 Download enhancement scripts"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[2],1,"betteR20"],[0,[],0," (requires "],[0,[3],1,"Tampermonkey"],[0,[],0," plugin)"]],[[0,[4],1,"VTT Enhancement Suite"],[0,[],0," (standalone browser plugin)"]]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"They enhance the overall gameplay, providing tons of functionalities useful for both players and DMs. Used mostly for dynamic lightning. Remember to restart your browser after you install them."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.3 See more of the map"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Go to My Settings tab and set player avatar size to small. You will see more of the map."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.4 Switch to your role"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Switch your chat to your character. In most of the cases your player's nickname differs from your character's name, what makes speaking and acting as character a bit inconvenient from the perspective of other players. You can do it by picking your character name from the drop-down list under the chat."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0],2,"1.5 Ready your sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Find your sheet in Journal tab."],[0,[0,0],2," "],[0,[],0,"After you found it, you can double click to minimize it. Give it a glance - if you see any missing feature/spell/attack - please fix it in the meantime, as soon as possible."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also, make sure they all show effect's description (if such exists) upon click. Showing a spell with some rolled numbers, but without description of what the spell actually does forces DM to use Google or to ask you about the details - both ways take the time that could be otherwise used for roleplaying."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0],2,"1.6 Upgrade your rolls"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Set your character to Always Roll Advantage and Auto Roll Damage & Crit (there's a cog icon in your sheet). It will be enabled at default, and will make you roll twice (just in case you had advantage or disadvantage on that roll). This should speed the game up, since DM won't need to ask for extra rolls."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"2. The Roleplay"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Essentially, narrating your character's actions."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.1 In-character communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After switching to your character's name, all words typed straight into the chat (without extra commands, nor parentheses) count as words spoken by your character, e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Vrap Rennen:"],[0,[],0," Hey, do you like riddles?"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.2 Out-of-character communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"To say something out-of-roleplay, you can switch to your player name or use round brackets or "],[0,[0],1,"/ooc <message>"],[0,[],0," command, e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"Marcin Z.:"],[0,[],0," Thanks for the game!"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"Eahthryd:"],[0,[],0," (I didn't end my turn yet)"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to avoid playing out of your character, since it essentially replaces storytelling with boring technical explanations, and often ends with anticlimatic meta-game (you can read about it in 2.8)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.3 Private communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"One of the best things in online sessions is possibility of conversing with DM without other players knowing about it. If you want to message specific player, type "],[0,[0],1,"/w <player_name> <message>"],[0,[],0,". Player name can be replaced with \"DM\", to whisper the DM."],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"(To Aleks K.)"],[0,[],0," What was on previous session?"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"(From Aleks K.)"],[0,[],0," Goblin killing. And we found that artifact."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"(To DM)"],[0,[],0," I would like to escape silently, without other "],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"characters knowing."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"(From DM)"],[0,[],0," Whisper Stealth roll to me"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"DM prioritizes whispering less than responding to public messages, so before you decide to whisper him, ask yourself if it really should remain a secret. If not, perhaps you can simply engage other players and their characters into it?"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to avoid roleplaying with other players in private, but if such thing happens - inform DM about potential story changes to avoid unnecessary branching."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.4 Acting"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"All non-spoken actions should be performed with "],[0,[0],1,"/e <description>"],[0,[],0," command, e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Liszt plays a calming song on her viol"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Crescent Moon tries to throw his glaive at the nasty "],[1,[],0,2],[0,[5,0],2,"monster"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If your character moved during the action, drag your character's token to appropriate place on map."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If other player characters aren't supposed to know what you're attempting to do (because they're all too far away or you want to be stealthy), consider whispering DM with description of your actions."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.5 Rolling"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"During your turn in initiative order (or when current turn) you may describe your character's interaction with environment or NPCs, and roll most appropriate skill check (if you're not sure what to roll, wait for DM's suggestions), e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Alma sneaks into the cave"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Tomasz H. (DM):"],[0,[],0," (roll Stealth)"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Alma:"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[5,0],2,"6 | 18"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[5,0],1,"STEALTH"],[0,[],1," (+3)"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"The beast growls, after it notices you!"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's also possible to whisper roll to DM, by choosing appropriate option in sheet."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If there's anything you can roleplay, then just do it - it gives DM more time for managing mechanics of the game. It is advised to roleplay all resolved rolls using"],[0,[0,0],2," /e <description>"],[0,[],0,", e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Koragit Thume dodged the flying bolt in the last moment! "]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Duadin jumped over the fence with agility of a cat"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Gray Fullbuster slices the enemy in half, covering his whole sword in blood!"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.6 Managing sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Since sheet's owners can freely edit their sheets, they should manage them during sessions, too - it gives DM more time to keep the story going. Common cases of it include (but aren't limited to) adding/removing items from inventory (if they're not in Compendium tab, find them "],[0,[6],1,"here"],[0,[],0,"), setting item weights, updating Hit Points after being hit, or number of Spell Slots after casting a spell."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Of course DM is not capable of tracking your whole sheet 24/7, but he's capable of balancing trickeries he finds out, sooner or later. It's all about the honesty."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.7 Efficient Roleplay"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The key to a good session is to follow (any) defined standards or protocols in order to minimize time spent on organizational discussions and maximize time spent on actual roleplaying. In order to keep it quick, messages containing environment-altering roleplay (like pulling levers, infiltrating chests, casting spells, performing attacks, speaking to NPCs) should be sent only after DM has responded to previous roleplay of such type. After all, DM's attention is limited."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In rare case where more of actions appear in the same moment, DM will eventually respond to all of them in order, but don't expect him to track your message if it was posted a moment after last environmental roleplay (since it's a sign you're not paying attention to other players' roleplays). If you think your message could be such a stowaway, please remind DM of your action after he finishes responding to last valid environmental action."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Let's suppose, by stroke of unluck, two players send their actions with appropriate rolls in the same moment:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Grag investigates the surroundings"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Alyssa tries to hear, what's on the other side of the door"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Alyssa:"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[0],1,"4"],[0,[5,0],2," | 6"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[5,0],1,"PERCEPTION "],[0,[],1,"(+3)"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Grag:"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[5,0],2,"17 | 14"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[5,0],1,"INVESTIGATION"],[0,[],1," (+2)"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Such things happen, so DM has to resolve their rolls anyway."],[1,[],0,9],[0,[],0,"5 seconds pass, DM is still writing aggregated response, players continue light roleplay..."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Alyssa"],[0,[0],1,":"],[0,[],0," Silence! I'm gonna check if there's something on the opposite side!"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Suddenly, third player kicks in with his rolled action!"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Snickwicks tries to unlock the door!"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5,0],2,"Snickwicks:"],[1,[],0,10],[0,[5,0],2,"21 | 16"],[1,[],0,11],[0,[5,0],1,"SLEIGH OF HAND "],[0,[],1,"(+5)"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Tomasz H.
